Analyze your product's codebase and install Agent OS

Refer to the instructions located in @~/.agent-os/instructions/analyze-product.md
I'll analyze the Chiron codebase and install Agent OS following the instructions. Let me start by thoroughly examining the existing codebase to understand its current state.

file.content:
# frozen_string_literal: true

require_relative 'lib/chiron/version'

Gem::Specification.new do |spec|
  spec.name = 'chiron'
  spec.version = Chiron::VERSION
  spec.authors = ['Brett McHargue']
  spec.email = ['ebrett@users.noreply.github.com']

  spec.summary = 'Initialize Claude AI workflow for Rails and Python projects'
  spec.description = 'A Ruby gem that sets up Claude AI development workflows, PRD templates, ' \
                     'and journaling system for Rails and Python projects'
  spec.homepage = 'https://github.com/ebrett/chiron'
  spec.license = 'MIT'
  spec.required_ruby_version = '>= 3.0.0'

  spec.metadata['homepage_uri'] = spec.homepage
  spec.metadata['source_code_uri'] = spec.homepage
  spec.metadata['changelog_uri'] = "#{spec.homepage}/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md"
  spec.metadata['rubygems_mfa_required'] = 'true'

  # Specify which files should be added to the gem when it is released.
  spec.files = Dir.chdir(__dir__) do
    `git ls-files -z`.split("\x0").reject do |f|
      (f == __FILE__) || f.match(%r{\A(?:(?:bin|test|spec|features)/|\.(?:git|circleci)|appveyor)})
    end
  end
  spec.bindir = 'exe'
  spec.executables = spec.files.grep(%r{\Aexe/}) { |f| File.basename(f) }
  spec.require_paths = ['lib']

  # Runtime dependencies
  spec.add_dependency 'colorize', '~> 1.1'
  spec.add_dependency 'thor', '~> 1.3'
  spec.add_dependency 'tty-prompt', '~> 0.23'

  # Development dependencies
  spec.add_development_dependency 'bundler', '~> 2.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rake', '~> 13.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rspec', '~> 3.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rubocop', '~> 1.21'
end

1‚Üí# frozen_string_literal: true
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üírequire 'thor'
     4‚Üírequire 'tty-prompt'
     5‚Üírequire 'colorize'
     6‚Üírequire 'fileutils'
     7‚Üírequire 'erb'
     8‚Üírequire 'date'
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üímodule Chiron
    11‚Üí  class CLI < Thor
    12‚Üí    def self.exit_on_failure?
    13‚Üí      true
    14‚Üí    end
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí    desc 'init', 'Initialize Claude workflow in current project'
    17‚Üí    option :project_name, type: :string, desc: 'Project name for CLAUDE.md'
    18‚Üí    option :user_name, type: :string, desc: 'User name for templates. Auto-detected from git config if not specified'
    19‚Üí    option :type, type: :string, desc: 'Project type (rails, python). Auto-detected if not specified'
    20‚Üí    option :with_oauth, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include OAuth workflow examples'
    21‚Üí    option :with_viewcomponents, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include ViewComponent rules'
    22‚Üí    option :with_django, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include Django-specific patterns'
    23‚Üí    option :with_fastapi, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include FastAPI-specific patterns'
    24‚Üí    option :skip_journal, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Skip development journal setup'
    25‚Üí    def init
    26‚Üí      say 'ü§ñ Initializing Claude Setup...'.colorize(:blue)
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí      @prompt = TTY::Prompt.new
    29‚Üí      @project_type = determine_project_type
    30‚Üí      @project_name = options[:project_name] || prompt_for_project_name
    31‚Üí      @user_name = options[:user_name] || detect_user_name
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí      # Set up project configuration
    34‚Üí      if @project_type == :python
    35‚Üí        @python_framework = detect_python_framework
    36‚Üí        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type, @python_framework)
    37‚Üí      else
    38‚Üí        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type)
    39‚Üí      end
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí      check_project_compatibility
    42‚Üí      create_directories
    43‚Üí      copy_templates
    44‚Üí      update_gitignore
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Claude workflow initialized successfully!".colorize(:green)
    47‚Üí      say "\nNext steps:".colorize(:yellow)
    48‚Üí      say '  1. Review and customize CLAUDE.md for your project'
    49‚Üí      say '  2. Check .claude/commands/ for available workflows'
    50‚Üí      say "  3. Run 'claude' to start using Claude with your new setup"
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí      # Project-specific suggestions
    53‚Üí      case @project_type
    54‚Üí      when :python
    55‚Üí        say "\nPython project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
    56‚Üí        say '  - Install dev dependencies: pip install pytest black flake8'
    57‚Üí        say '  - Set up pre-commit hooks for code quality'
    58‚Üí        say '  - Configure your IDE to use black formatting'
    59‚Üí      when :rails
    60‚Üí        say "\nRails project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
    61‚Üí        say '  - Ensure binstubs are set up: bundle binstubs bundler --force'
    62‚Üí        say "  - Run 'bin/rubocop' to check code style"
    63‚Üí        say "  - Use 'bin/rspec' for running tests"
    64‚Üí      end
    65‚Üí    end
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí    desc 'migrate-cursor', 'Migrate from .cursor to .claude structure'
    68‚Üí    def migrate_cursor
    69‚Üí      say 'üîÑ Migrating from .cursor to .claude...'.colorize(:blue)
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí      unless Dir.exist?('.cursor/rules')
    72‚Üí        error 'No .cursor/rules directory found!'
    73‚Üí        exit 1
    74‚Üí      end
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí      create_directories
    77‚Üí      migrate_rules
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí      if @prompt.yes?('Remove .cursor directory after migration?')
    80‚Üí        FileUtils.rm_rf('.cursor')
    81‚Üí        say '‚úÖ .cursor directory removed'.colorize(:green)
    82‚Üí      end
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Migration completed!".colorize(:green)
    85‚Üí    end
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí    desc 'add-workflow WORKFLOW', 'Add a specific workflow to your setup'
    88‚Üí    def add_workflow(workflow_name)
    89‚Üí      available_workflows = Dir.glob(File.join(templates_path, 'commands/**/*.md'))
    90‚Üí                               .map { |f| File.basename(f, '.md') }
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí      unless available_workflows.include?(workflow_name)
    93‚Üí        error "Unknown workflow: #{workflow_name}"
    94‚Üí        say "Available workflows: #{available_workflows.join(', ')}"
    95‚Üí        exit 1
    96‚Üí      end
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí      copy_workflow(workflow_name)
    99‚Üí      say "‚úÖ Added #{workflow_name} workflow".colorize(:green)
   100‚Üí    end
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí    desc 'update', 'Update Claude workflows to latest version'
   103‚Üí    def update
   104‚Üí      say 'üîÑ Updating Claude workflows...'.colorize(:blue)
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí      # Backup current commands
   107‚Üí      if Dir.exist?('.claude/commands')
   108‚Üí        backup_dir = ".claude/commands.backup.#{Time.now.strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S')}"
   109‚Üí        FileUtils.cp_r('.claude/commands', backup_dir)
   110‚Üí        say "üì¶ Backed up current commands to #{backup_dir}".colorize(:yellow)
   111‚Üí      end
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí      copy_templates(update: true)
   114‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Workflows updated!".colorize(:green)
   115‚Üí    end
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí    desc 'doctor', 'Check Claude setup health'
   118‚Üí    def doctor
   119‚Üí      say 'üè• Running Claude setup diagnostics...'.colorize(:blue)
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí      project_type = detect_project_type
   122‚Üí      checks = {
   123‚Üí        "#{project_type.to_s.capitalize} project" => project_type != :unknown,
   124‚Üí        'CLAUDE.md exists' => File.exist?('CLAUDE.md'),
   125‚Üí        '.claude directory' => Dir.exist?('.claude'),
   126‚Üí        '.claude/commands' => Dir.exist?('.claude/commands'),
   127‚Üí        'Development journal' => File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md'),
   128‚Üí        'Tasks directory' => Dir.exist?('tasks'),
   129‚Üí        '.gitignore entry' => begin
   130‚Üí          File.read('.gitignore').include?('.claude/')
   131‚Üí        rescue StandardError
   132‚Üí          false
   133‚Üí        end
   134‚Üí      }
   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí      # Add project-specific checks
   137‚Üí      case project_type
   138‚Üí      when :rails
   139‚Üí        checks['Gemfile exists'] = File.exist?('Gemfile')
   140‚Üí        checks['Rails app structure'] = Dir.exist?('app')
   141‚Üí      when :python
   142‚Üí        checks['Python package file'] = python_package_exists?
   143‚Üí      end
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí      checks.each do |check, result|
   146‚Üí        status = result ? '‚úÖ'.colorize(:green) : '‚ùå'.colorize(:red)
   147‚Üí        say "#{status} #{check}"
   148‚Üí      end
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí      if checks.values.all?
   151‚Üí        say "\n‚ú® All checks passed!".colorize(:green)
   152‚Üí      else
   153‚Üí        say "\n‚ö†Ô∏è  Some checks failed. Run 'chiron init' to fix.".colorize(:yellow)
   154‚Üí      end
   155‚Üí    end
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí    desc 'version', 'Show version'
   158‚Üí    def version
   159‚Üí      say Chiron::VERSION
   160‚Üí    end
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí    private
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí    def prompt_for_project_name
   165‚Üí      @prompt.ask("What's your project name?") do |q|
   166‚Üí        q.required true
   167‚Üí        q.default File.basename(Dir.pwd)
   168‚Üí      end
   169‚Üí    end
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí    def determine_project_type
   172‚Üí      return options[:type].to_sym if options[:type]
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí      detected_type = detect_project_type
   175‚Üí      if detected_type == :unknown
   176‚Üí        @prompt.select('What type of project is this?') do |menu|
   177‚Üí          menu.choice 'Rails', :rails
   178‚Üí          menu.choice 'Python', :python
   179‚Üí        end
   180‚Üí      else
   181‚Üí        say "Detected #{detected_type} project".colorize(:green)
   182‚Üí        detected_type
   183‚Üí      end
   184‚Üí    end
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí    def detect_project_type
   187‚Üí      if File.exist?('Gemfile') && File.read('Gemfile').include?('rails')
   188‚Üí        :rails
   189‚Üí      elsif python_package_exists?
   190‚Üí        :python
   191‚Üí      else
   192‚Üí        :unknown
   193‚Üí      end
   194‚Üí    end
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí    def detect_python_framework
   197‚Üí      if File.exist?('manage.py')
   198‚Üí        :django
   199‚Üí      elsif File.exist?('app.py') || File.exist?('main.py')
   200‚Üí        if File.exist?('requirements.txt')
   201‚Üí          content = File.read('requirements.txt')
   202‚Üí          return :fastapi if content.include?('fastapi')
   203‚Üí          return :flask if content.include?('flask')
   204‚Üí        end
   205‚Üí        :generic
   206‚Üí      else
   207‚Üí        :generic
   208‚Üí      end
   209‚Üí    end
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    def check_project_compatibility
   212‚Üí      case @project_type
   213‚Üí      when :rails
   214‚Üí        unless File.exist?('Gemfile')
   215‚Üí          error "This doesn't appear to be a Rails project!"
   216‚Üí          exit 1
   217‚Üí        end
   218‚Üí      when :python
   219‚Üí        if !python_package_exists? && @prompt.yes?('No Python package file found. Create requirements.txt?')
   220‚Üí          File.write('requirements.txt', "# Python dependencies\n")
   221‚Üí        end
   222‚Üí      end
   223‚Üí    end
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí    def create_directories
   226‚Üí      dirs = [
   227‚Üí        '.claude/commands/workflows',
   228‚Üí        '.claude/commands/conventions',
   229‚Üí        '.claude/commands/context',
   230‚Üí        '.claude/commands/journal',
   231‚Üí        '.claude/commands/quality',
   232‚Üí        'tasks',
   233‚Üí        'docs'
   234‚Üí      ]
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí      dirs.each do |dir|
   237‚Üí        FileUtils.mkdir_p(dir)
   238‚Üí        say "üìÅ Created #{dir}".colorize(:light_blue) unless Dir.exist?(dir)
   239‚Üí      end
   240‚Üí    end
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí    def copy_templates(update: false)
   243‚Üí      # Copy CLAUDE.md template
   244‚Üí      unless update
   245‚Üí        template_path = File.join(templates_path, @project_type.to_s, 'CLAUDE.md.erb')
   246‚Üí        # Fall back to shared template if project-specific doesn't exist
   247‚Üí        template_path = File.join(templates_path, 'CLAUDE.md.erb') unless File.exist?(template_path)
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí        if File.exist?(template_path)
   250‚Üí          @python_framework = detect_python_framework if @project_type == :python
   251‚Üí          content = ERB.new(File.read(template_path)).result(binding)
   252‚Üí          File.write('CLAUDE.md', content)
   253‚Üí          say 'üìÑ Created CLAUDE.md'.colorize(:light_blue)
   254‚Üí        end
   255‚Üí      end
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí      # Copy command templates
   258‚Üí      copy_commands
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí      # Copy settings.json
   261‚Üí      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'claude', 'settings.json')
   262‚Üí      # Fall back to root claude dir if shared doesn't exist
   263‚Üí      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'claude', 'settings.json') unless File.exist?(settings_path)
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí      if File.exist?(settings_path) && !File.exist?('.claude/settings.json')
   266‚Üí        FileUtils.cp(settings_path, '.claude/settings.json')
   267‚Üí        say '‚öôÔ∏è  Created .claude/settings.json'.colorize(:light_blue)
   268‚Üí      end
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí      # Initialize development journal
   271‚Üí      return if options[:skip_journal] || File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md')
   272‚Üí
   273‚Üí      create_development_journal
   274‚Üí    end
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí    def copy_commands
   277‚Üí      # Copy shared commands first
   278‚Üí      shared_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'commands')
   279‚Üí      if Dir.exist?(shared_commands_dir)

# frozen_string_literal: true

require 'thor'
require 'tty-prompt'
require 'colorize'
require 'fileutils'
require 'erb'
require 'date'

module Chiron
  class CLI < Thor
    def self.exit_on_failure?
      true
    end

    desc 'init', 'Initialize Claude workflow in current project'
    option :project_name, type: :string, desc: 'Project name for CLAUDE.md'
    option :user_name, type: :string, desc: 'User name for templates. Auto-detected from git config if not specified'
    option :type, type: :string, desc: 'Project type (rails, python). Auto-detected if not specified'
    option :with_oauth, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include OAuth workflow examples'
    option :with_viewcomponents, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include ViewComponent rules'
    option :with_django, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include Django-specific patterns'
    option :with_fastapi, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include FastAPI-specific patterns'
    option :skip_journal, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Skip development journal setup'
    def init
      say 'ü§ñ Initializing Claude Setup...'.colorize(:blue)

      @prompt = TTY::Prompt.new
      @project_type = determine_project_type
      @project_name = options[:project_name] || prompt_for_project_name
      @user_name = options[:user_name] || detect_user_name

      # Set up project configuration
      if @project_type == :python
        @python_framework = detect_python_framework
        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type, @python_framework)
      else
        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type)
      end

      check_project_compatibility
      create_directories
      copy_templates
      update_gitignore

      say "\n‚ú® Claude workflow initialized successfully!".colorize(:green)
      say "\nNext steps:".colorize(:yellow)
      say '  1. Review and customize CLAUDE.md for your project'
      say '  2. Check .claude/commands/ for available workflows'
      say "  3. Run 'claude' to start using Claude with your new setup"

      # Project-specific suggestions
      case @project_type
      when :python
        say "\nPython project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
        say '  - Install dev dependencies: pip install pytest black flake8'
        say '  - Set up pre-commit hooks for code quality'
        say '  - Configure your IDE to use black formatting'
      when :rails
        say "\nRails project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
        say '  - Ensure binstubs are set up: bundle binstubs bundler --force'
        say "  - Run 'bin/rubocop' to check code style"
        say "  - Use 'bin/rspec' for running tests"
      end
    end

    desc 'migrate-cursor', 'Migrate from .cursor to .claude structure'
    def migrate_cursor
      say 'üîÑ Migrating from .cursor to .claude...'.colorize(:blue)

      unless Dir.exist?('.cursor/rules')
        error 'No .cursor/rules directory found!'
        exit 1
      end

      create_directories
      migrate_rules

      if @prompt.yes?('Remove .cursor directory after migration?')
        FileUtils.rm_rf('.cursor')
        say '‚úÖ .cursor directory removed'.colorize(:green)
      end

      say "\n‚ú® Migration completed!".colorize(:green)
    end

    desc 'add-workflow WORKFLOW', 'Add a specific workflow to your setup'
    def add_workflow(workflow_name)
      available_workflows = Dir.glob(File.join(templates_path, 'commands/**/*.md'))
                               .map { |f| File.basename(f, '.md') }

      unless available_workflows.include?(workflow_name)
        error "Unknown workflow: #{workflow_name}"
        say "Available workflows: #{available_workflows.join(', ')}"
        exit 1
      end

      copy_workflow(workflow_name)
      say "‚úÖ Added #{workflow_name} workflow".colorize(:green)
    end

    desc 'update', 'Update Claude workflows to latest version'
    def update
      say 'üîÑ Updating Claude workflows...'.colorize(:blue)

      # Backup current commands
      if Dir.exist?('.claude/commands')
        backup_dir = ".claude/commands.backup.#{Time.now.strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S')}"
        FileUtils.cp_r('.claude/commands', backup_dir)
        say "üì¶ Backed up current commands to #{backup_dir}".colorize(:yellow)
      end

      copy_templates(update: true)
      say "\n‚ú® Workflows updated!".colorize(:green)
    end

    desc 'doctor', 'Check Claude setup health'
    def doctor
      say 'üè• Running Claude setup diagnostics...'.colorize(:blue)

      project_type = detect_project_type
      checks = {
        "#{project_type.to_s.capitalize} project" => project_type != :unknown,
        'CLAUDE.md exists' => File.exist?('CLAUDE.md'),
        '.claude directory' => Dir.exist?('.claude'),
        '.claude/commands' => Dir.exist?('.claude/commands'),
        'Development journal' => File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md'),
        'Tasks directory' => Dir.exist?('tasks'),
        '.gitignore entry' => begin
          File.read('.gitignore').include?('.claude/')
        rescue StandardError
          false
        end
      }

      # Add project-specific checks
      case project_type
      when :rails
        checks['Gemfile exists'] = File.exist?('Gemfile')
        checks['Rails app structure'] = Dir.exist?('app')
      when :python
        checks['Python package file'] = python_package_exists?
      end

      checks.each do |check, result|
        status = result ? '‚úÖ'.colorize(:green) : '‚ùå'.colorize(:red)
        say "#{status} #{check}"
      end

      if checks.values.all?
        say "\n‚ú® All checks passed!".colorize(:green)
      else
        say "\n‚ö†Ô∏è  Some checks failed. Run 'chiron init' to fix.".colorize(:yellow)
      end
    end

    desc 'version', 'Show version'
    def version
      say Chiron::VERSION
    end

    private

    def prompt_for_project_name
      @prompt.ask("What's your project name?") do |q|
        q.required true
        q.default File.basename(Dir.pwd)
      end
    end

    def determine_project_type
      return options[:type].to_sym if options[:type]

      detected_type = detect_project_type
      if detected_type == :unknown
        @prompt.select('What type of project is this?') do |menu|
          menu.choice 'Rails', :rails
          menu.choice 'Python', :python
        end
      else
        say "Detected #{detected_type} project".colorize(:green)
        detected_type
      end
    end

    def detect_project_type
      if File.exist?('Gemfile') && File.read('Gemfile').include?('rails')
        :rails
      elsif python_package_exists?
        :python
      else
        :unknown
      end
    end

    def detect_python_framework
      if File.exist?('manage.py')
        :django
      elsif File.exist?('app.py') || File.exist?('main.py')
        if File.exist?('requirements.txt')
          content = File.read('requirements.txt')
          return :fastapi if content.include?('fastapi')
          return :flask if content.include?('flask')
        end
        :generic
      else
        :generic
      end
    end

    def check_project_compatibility
      case @project_type
      when :rails
        unless File.exist?('Gemfile')
          error "This doesn't appear to be a Rails project!"
          exit 1
        end
      when :python
        if !python_package_exists? && @prompt.yes?('No Python package file found. Create requirements.txt?')
          File.write('requirements.txt', "# Python dependencies\n")
        end
      end
    end

    def create_directories
      dirs = [
        '.claude/commands/workflows',
        '.claude/commands/conventions',
        '.claude/commands/context',
        '.claude/commands/journal',
        '.claude/commands/quality',
        'tasks',
        'docs'
      ]

      dirs.each do |dir|
        FileUtils.mkdir_p(dir)
        say "üìÅ Created #{dir}".colorize(:light_blue) unless Dir.exist?(dir)
      end
    end

    def copy_templates(update: false)
      # Copy CLAUDE.md template
      unless update
        template_path = File.join(templates_path, @project_type.to_s, 'CLAUDE.md.erb')
        # Fall back to shared template if project-specific doesn't exist
        template_path = File.join(templates_path, 'CLAUDE.md.erb') unless File.exist?(template_path)

        if File.exist?(template_path)
          @python_framework = detect_python_framework if @project_type == :python
          content = ERB.new(File.read(template_path)).result(binding)
          File.write('CLAUDE.md', content)
          say 'üìÑ Created CLAUDE.md'.colorize(:light_blue)
        end
      end

      # Copy command templates
      copy_commands

      # Copy settings.json
      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'claude', 'settings.json')
      # Fall back to root claude dir if shared doesn't exist
      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'claude', 'settings.json') unless File.exist?(settings_path)

      if File.exist?(settings_path) && !File.exist?('.claude/settings.json')
        FileUtils.cp(settings_path, '.claude/settings.json')
        say '‚öôÔ∏è  Created .claude/settings.json'.colorize(:light_blue)
      end

      # Initialize development journal
      return if options[:skip_journal] || File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md')

      create_development_journal
    end

    def copy_commands
      # Copy shared commands first
      shared_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'commands')
      if Dir.exist?(shared_commands_dir)
        Dir.glob(File.join(shared_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
          relative_path = file.sub("#{shared_commands_dir}/", '')
          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)

          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
          say "üìã Copied shared: #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
        end
      end

      # Copy project-specific commands
      project_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, @project_type.to_s, 'commands')
      if Dir.exist?(project_commands_dir)
        Dir.glob(File.join(project_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
          relative_path = file.sub("#{project_commands_dir}/", '')
          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)

          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
          say "üìã Copied #{@project_type}: #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
        end
      end

      # Fall back to legacy commands if new structure doesn't exist
      legacy_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, 'commands')
      if !Dir.exist?(shared_commands_dir) && !Dir.exist?(project_commands_dir) && Dir.exist?(legacy_commands_dir)
        Dir.glob(File.join(legacy_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
          relative_path = file.sub("#{legacy_commands_dir}/", '')
          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)

          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
          say "üìã Copied #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
        end
      end
    end

    def create_development_journal
      journal_template = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'development_journal.md.erb')
      # Fall back to root if shared doesn't exist
      journal_template = File.join(templates_path, 'development_journal.md.erb') unless File.exist?(journal_template)
      return unless File.exist?(journal_template)

      content = ERB.new(File.read(journal_template)).result(binding)
      File.write('docs/development_journal.md', content)
      say 'üìì Created development journal'.colorize(:light_blue)
    end

    def update_gitignore
      gitignore_path = '.gitignore'
      return unless File.exist?(gitignore_path)

      gitignore_content = File.read(gitignore_path)

      return if gitignore_content.include?('.claude/')

      File.open(gitignore_path, 'a') do |f|
        f.puts "\n# Claude Code settings (but allow commands directory)"
        f.puts '.claude/*'
        f.puts '!.claude/commands/'
      end
      say 'üìù Updated .gitignore'.colorize(:light_blue)
    end

    def migrate_rules
      Dir.glob('.cursor/rules/*.mdc').each do |rule_file|
        filename = File.basename(rule_file, '.mdc')

        # Map cursor rules to claude command structure
        target_dir = case filename
                     when 'create-prd', 'generate-tasks', 'process-task-list'
                       '.claude/commands/workflows'
                     when 'rails', 'view_component'
                       '.claude/commands/conventions'
                     when 'test-driven'
                       '.claude/commands/quality'
                     else
                       '.claude/commands/workflows'
                     end

        target_path = File.join(target_dir, "#{filename}.md")

        # Copy and transform the content
        content = File.read(rule_file)
        # Remove cursor-specific frontmatter
        content = content.sub(/---.*?---/m, '').strip

        File.write(target_path, content)
        say "üìã Migrated #{filename}".colorize(:light_blue)
      end
    end

    def templates_path
      Chiron.templates_path
    end

    def python_package_exists?
      File.exist?('requirements.txt') || File.exist?('pyproject.toml') ||
        File.exist?('setup.py') || File.exist?('Pipfile')
    end

    def detect_user_name
      # Try git config first
      git_user = `git config user.name 2>/dev/null`.strip
      return git_user if !git_user.empty?

      # Fall back to environment variables
      env_user = ENV['USER'] || ENV['USERNAME']
      return env_user if env_user && !env_user.empty?

      # Last resort: prompt the user
      @prompt.ask('What is your name?', default: 'Developer')
    rescue StandardError
      'Developer'
    end

    def error(message)
      say "‚ùå #{message}".colorize(:red)
    end
  end
end

# frozen_string_literal: true

source 'https://rubygems.org'

# Specify your gem's dependencies in claude_rails_setup.gemspec
gemspec

gem 'rake', '~> 13.0'
gem 'rspec', '~> 3.0'
gem 'rubocop', '~> 1.21'

# Development tools
group :development do
  gem 'pry'
  gem 'yard'
end

1‚Üí# Chiron
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA Ruby gem that initializes Claude AI development workflows, PRD templates, and journaling system for Rails and Python projects. Named after the wise centaur who mentored heroes, Chiron helps you quickly set up a structured development process that integrates seamlessly with Claude Code.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## Features
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí- üöÄ **Quick Setup**: Initialize Claude workflow with one command
     8‚Üí- üìã **PRD Workflow**: Structured Product Requirements Document creation
     9‚Üí- ‚úÖ **Task Management**: Generate and track implementation tasks
    10‚Üí- üìì **Development Journal**: Track progress and maintain project history
    11‚Üí- üîÑ **Migration Tool**: Easy migration from `.cursor` to `.claude` structure
    12‚Üí- üéØ **Quality Checks**: Pre-commit checklists and TDD workflows
    13‚Üí- üõ†Ô∏è **Customizable**: Adapt workflows to your team's needs
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## Installation
    16‚Üí
    17‚ÜíAdd this line to your application's Gemfile:
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí```ruby
    20‚Üígem 'chiron'
    21‚Üí```
    22‚Üí
    23‚ÜíAnd then execute:
    24‚Üí```bash
    25‚Üíbundle install
    26‚Üí```
    27‚Üí
    28‚ÜíOr install it yourself as:
    29‚Üí```bash
    30‚Üígem install chiron
    31‚Üí```
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí## Usage
    34‚Üí
    35‚Üí### Initialize Claude Workflow
    36‚Üí
    37‚ÜíIn your project root (Rails or Python):

file.content:
# Chiron

A Ruby gem that initializes Claude AI development workflows, PRD templates, and journaling system for Rails and Python projects. Named after the wise centaur who mentored heroes, Chiron helps you quickly set up a structured development process that integrates seamlessly with Claude Code.

## Features

- üöÄ **Quick Setup**: Initialize Claude workflow with one command
- üìã **PRD Workflow**: Structured Product Requirements Document creation
- ‚úÖ **Task Management**: Generate and track implementation tasks
- üìì **Development Journal**: Track progress and maintain project history
- üîÑ **Migration Tool**: Easy migration from `.cursor` to `.claude` structure
- üéØ **Quality Checks**: Pre-commit checklists and TDD workflows
- üõ†Ô∏è **Customizable**: Adapt workflows to your team's needs

## Installation

Add this line to your application's Gemfile:

```ruby
gem 'chiron'
```

And then execute:
```bash
bundle install
```

Or install it yourself as:
```bash
gem install chiron
```

## Usage

### Initialize Claude Workflow

In your project root (Rails or Python):

```bash
chiron init
```

This will:
- Auto-detect your project type (Rails/Python)
- Create `.claude/commands/` directory with workflow templates
- Generate `CLAUDE.md` with language-specific configuration
- Set up `tasks/` directory for PRDs and task lists
- Initialize development journal in `docs/`
- Update `.gitignore` appropriately

### Command Options

```bash
# Initialize Rails project with options
chiron init --project-name="MyApp" --with-viewcomponents

# Initialize Python project with framework-specific patterns
chiron init --type=python --with-django
chiron init --type=python --with-fastapi

# Migrate from .cursor to .claude
chiron migrate-cursor

# Add specific workflow
chiron add-workflow test-driven

# Update workflows to latest version
chiron update

# Check setup health
chiron doctor
```

## Workflow Structure

After initialization, you'll have:

```
your-project/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ .claude/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ commands/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ workflows/      # Development workflows
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ create-prd.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ generate-tasks.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ process-tasks.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ debug-python.md    # Python debugging (Python projects)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ python-refactor.md # Python refactoring (Python projects)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ flask-development.md # Flask patterns (Flask projects)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ conventions/    # Language/framework rules
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rails.md    # Rails-specific
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ python.md   # Python-specific
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ context/        # Context commands
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ quickstart.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ catchup.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ journal/        # Journal management
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ instructions.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ template.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ quality/        # Quality assurance
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ pre-commit.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ test-driven.md
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ python-testing.md  # Python testing (Python projects)
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ settings.json       # Claude permissions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ CLAUDE.md              # Project-specific Claude instructions
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tasks/                 # PRDs and task lists
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ development_journal.md
```

## Key Workflows

### 1. Creating a PRD
When starting a new feature, Claude will:
- Ask clarifying questions
- Generate a structured PRD
- Save it as `tasks/prd-[feature-name].md`

### 2. Generating Tasks
From a PRD, Claude will:
- Create high-level tasks
- Break them into subtasks
- Save as `tasks/tasks-prd-[feature-name].md`

### 3. Development Journal
Claude maintains a journal with:
- Daily work summaries
- Technical decisions
- Bug fixes and features
- Multi-developer collaboration tracking

### 4. Quality Checks
Before committing:
- Run the pre-commit checklist
- Follow TDD workflow
- Update documentation

## Example Claude Commands

After setup, you can tell Claude:

- "Create a PRD for user authentication"
- "Generate tasks from prd-user-auth.md"
- "Catchup" (for project status)
- "Update the journal"
- "Run pre-commit checks"

### Language-Specific Commands

**Rails:**
- "Run RuboCop on this file"
- "Generate an RSpec test"
- "Create a Rails migration"

**Python:**
- "Format this with Black"
- "Create a pytest fixture"
- "Generate a Django model"
- "Debug this async function"
- "Refactor this class using SOLID principles"
- "Add type hints to this function"

## Supported Project Types

### Rails Projects
- Full Rails conventions and best practices
- RSpec testing patterns
- Hotwire/Stimulus integration
- ViewComponent support (optional)
- RuboCop for code quality

### Python Projects
- Auto-detects Django, FastAPI, Flask, or generic Python
- pytest testing patterns with fixtures and parametrization
- Black/flake8/mypy for code quality and type checking
- Framework-specific templates (Django ORM, FastAPI async, Flask blueprints)
- Debugging workflows with pdb and logging
- Refactoring patterns and SOLID principles
- Virtual environment and dependency management best practices

## Customization

All templates are customizable. After initialization:
1. Edit files in `.claude/commands/` to match your workflow
2. Modify `CLAUDE.md` for project-specific instructions
3. Add custom workflows as needed

## Development

After checking out the repo, run `bin/setup` to install dependencies. Then, run `rake spec` to run the tests.

To install this gem onto your local machine, run `bundle exec rake install`.

## Contributing

Bug reports and pull requests are welcome on GitHub at https://github.com/ebrett/chiron.

## License

The gem is available as open source under the terms of the [MIT License](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

1‚Üí# Development Journal - Chiron Gem
     2‚Üí
     3‚Üí## Project Overview
     4‚ÜíChiron is a Ruby gem that helps Rails and Python developers set up Claude AI workflows, PRD templates, and development journaling systems.
     5‚Üí
     6‚Üí---
     7‚Üí
     8‚Üí## 2025-07-01 - Enhancement: Claude Code Best Practices Integration
     9‚Üí**Developer(s)**: Claude Code | **Branch**: main | **Context**: User research into Claude Code best practices
    10‚Üí
    11‚Üí### What was accomplished today:
    12‚Üí- **Template Enhancement**: Updated Rails and Python CLAUDE.md templates with best practices from https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices
    13‚Üí- **Extended Thinking Integration**: Added "think" triggers to workflow templates for complex problem solving
    14‚Üí- **Test Verification Focus**: Enhanced TDD template to emphasize test failure verification before implementation
    15‚Üí- **New Workflow Templates**: Created comprehensive Explore-Plan-Code-Commit and Visual Iteration workflows
    16‚Üí- **Tool Permissions Guidance**: Added tool customization sections to help developers manage Claude Code permissions
    17‚Üí- **Documentation Improvements**: Added quick documentation tips and conversational Q&A guidance
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### Technical decisions made:
    20‚Üí- **Incremental Enhancement**: Modified existing templates rather than replacing them to maintain backward compatibility
    21‚Üí- **Best Practice Integration**: Incorporated structured workflows (Explore-Plan-Code-Commit) recommended by Anthropic
    22‚Üí- **Visual Development Support**: Added dedicated workflow for screenshot-driven UI development
    23‚Üí- **Test Quality Focus**: Enhanced TDD workflow to prevent test overfitting and ensure proper failure verification
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí### Implementation details:
    26‚Üí- **Updated Templates**: Both `rails/CLAUDE.md.erb` and `python/CLAUDE.md.erb` now include tool permissions, extended thinking, and visual development guidance
    27‚Üí- **New Workflow Files**: 
    28‚Üí  - `explore-plan-code-commit.md` - Structured development process
    29‚Üí  - `visual-iteration.md` - Screenshot-driven UI development
    30‚Üí- **Enhanced TDD**: Updated `test-driven.md` with failure verification and overfitting prevention
    31‚Üí- **Quality Assurance**: All 41 tests continue to pass, ensuring no breaking changes
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí### Files modified:
    34‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/rails/CLAUDE.md.erb` - Added best practices sections
    35‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/python/CLAUDE.md.erb` - Added best practices sections  
    36‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/create-prd.md` - Added extended thinking trigger
    37‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/quality/test-driven.md` - Enhanced with failure verification
    38‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/explore-plan-code-commit.md` - New comprehensive workflow
    39‚Üí- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/visual-iteration.md` - New UI development workflow
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí---
    42‚Üí
    43‚Üí## 2025-07-01 - Major Enhancement: Comprehensive Python Project Support
    44‚Üí**Developer(s)**: Claude Code | **Branch**: main | **Context**: User request for Python support
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí### What was accomplished today:
    47‚Üí- **Major Feature Release**: Added complete Python project support to Chiron gem
    48‚Üí- **Framework Detection**: Implemented auto-detection for Django, FastAPI, Flask, and generic Python projects
    49‚Üí- **Architecture Overhaul**: Created `ProjectConfig` class for language-agnostic tool management
    50‚Üí- **Template Reorganization**: Restructured templates into `rails/`, `python/`, and `shared/` directories
    51‚Üí- **Comprehensive Testing**: Expanded test suite from 5 to 41 tests with full Python coverage
    52‚Üí- **Documentation Update**: Enhanced README, CHANGELOG, and CLI help with Python examples
    53‚Üí- **RubyGems Publication**: Successfully published version 0.2.0 to RubyGems
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí### Technical decisions made:
    56‚Üí- **Multi-Language Architecture**: Designed extensible system supporting both Rails and Python
    57‚Üí- **Project Detection**: Auto-detects project type via `requirements.txt`, `pyproject.toml`, `setup.py`, `Pipfile`
    58‚Üí- **Framework Intelligence**: Identifies Django (`manage.py`), FastAPI/Flask (via requirements analysis)
    59‚Üí- **Template Strategy**: Shared workflows with language-specific conventions and patterns
    60‚Üí- **Backward Compatibility**: Maintained 100% compatibility with existing Rails functionality
    61‚Üí- **Configuration Management**: `ProjectConfig` class abstracts tool selection (pytest vs RSpec, black vs RuboCop)
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí### Features added:
    64‚Üí- **Python CLI Options**: `--type=python`, `--with-django`, `--with-fastapi` flags
    65‚Üí- **Smart Project Detection**: Interactive prompts for unknown project types

    67‚Üí  - Python Conventions (PEP 8, type hints, async patterns, framework best practices)

    69‚Üí  - Python Debugging (pdb workflows, logging strategies, performance profiling)
    70‚Üí  - Python Refactoring (SOLID principles, design patterns, code organization)
    71‚Üí  - Flask Development (blueprints, forms, testing, deployment patterns)
    72‚Üí- **Framework-Specific Content**: Dynamic CLAUDE.md templates based on detected frameworks
    73‚Üí- **Project-Specific Tips**: Contextual setup guidance after initialization
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí### Code quality metrics:
    76‚Üí- **RSpec**: 41 examples, 0 failures (8x increase in test coverage)
    77‚Üí- **New Test Categories**: Framework detection, ProjectConfig functionality, Python workflows
    78‚Üí- **RuboCop**: 29 minor offenses (mostly method length in CLI - acceptable for feature-rich CLI)
    79‚Üí- **Backward Compatibility**: All existing Rails tests continue to pass
    80‚Üí
    81‚Üí### Architecture improvements:

    83‚Üí  ```
    84‚Üí  lib/chiron/templates/
    85‚Üí  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rails/           # Rails-specific templates
    86‚Üí  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ python/          # Python-specific templates  
    87‚Üí  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ shared/          # Language-agnostic workflows
    88‚Üí  ```
    89‚Üí- **Language Detection**: Robust project type identification with fallback mechanisms
    90‚Üí- **Tool Configuration**: Abstracted command generation for testing, linting, formatting
    91‚Üí- **ERB Enhancement**: Framework-aware template rendering with conditional content
    92‚Üí
    93‚Üí### Bugs fixed:
    94‚Üí- **Template Fallbacks**: Graceful handling when project-specific templates don't exist
    95‚Üí- **CLI Robustness**: Improved error handling for unknown project types
    96‚Üí- **Cross-Platform**: Ensured Python detection works across different package managers
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí### Version and release:
    99‚Üí- **Version Bump**: 0.1.0 ‚Üí 0.2.0 (major feature enhancement)
   100‚Üí- **Gem Build**: Successfully built `chiron-0.2.0.gem`
   101‚Üí- **RubyGems**: Published to RubyGems registry
   102‚Üí- **Documentation**: Comprehensive CHANGELOG with technical details
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí### Impact and usage:
   105‚Üí- **Multi-Language Support**: Chiron now serves both Rails and Python ecosystems
   106‚Üí- **Framework Coverage**: Django, FastAPI, Flask, and generic Python projects supported
   107‚Üí- **Developer Experience**: Auto-detection eliminates manual configuration
   108‚Üí- **Workflow Richness**: Language-specific best practices and patterns included
   109‚Üí
   110‚Üí### Next steps:
   111‚Üí- Monitor RubyGems adoption and user feedback
   112‚Üí- Consider additional language support (Node.js, Go, etc.)
   113‚Üí- Enhance framework detection with more sophisticated analysis
   114‚Üí- Add more Python-specific workflow templates based on community needs
   115‚Üí- Create video documentation showing Python project initialization
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí### Notes:
   118‚Üí- This represents the largest enhancement to Chiron since its creation
   119‚Üí- Successfully maintained backward compatibility while adding major new functionality
   120‚Üí- Python support is comprehensive and production-ready
   121‚Üí- Architecture now supports easy addition of future languages
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí---
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí## 2025-01-21 - Initial Setup and Module Rename

file.content:
# Development Journal - Chiron Gem

## Project Overview
Chiron is a Ruby gem that helps Rails and Python developers set up Claude AI workflows, PRD templates, and development journaling systems.

---

## 2025-07-01 - Enhancement: Claude Code Best Practices Integration
**Developer(s)**: Claude Code | **Branch**: main | **Context**: User research into Claude Code best practices

### What was accomplished today:
- **Template Enhancement**: Updated Rails and Python CLAUDE.md templates with best practices from https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices
- **Extended Thinking Integration**: Added "think" triggers to workflow templates for complex problem solving
- **Test Verification Focus**: Enhanced TDD template to emphasize test failure verification before implementation
- **New Workflow Templates**: Created comprehensive Explore-Plan-Code-Commit and Visual Iteration workflows
- **Tool Permissions Guidance**: Added tool customization sections to help developers manage Claude Code permissions
- **Documentation Improvements**: Added quick documentation tips and conversational Q&A guidance

### Technical decisions made:
- **Incremental Enhancement**: Modified existing templates rather than replacing them to maintain backward compatibility
- **Best Practice Integration**: Incorporated structured workflows (Explore-Plan-Code-Commit) recommended by Anthropic
- **Visual Development Support**: Added dedicated workflow for screenshot-driven UI development
- **Test Quality Focus**: Enhanced TDD workflow to prevent test overfitting and ensure proper failure verification

### Implementation details:
- **Updated Templates**: Both `rails/CLAUDE.md.erb` and `python/CLAUDE.md.erb` now include tool permissions, extended thinking, and visual development guidance
- **New Workflow Files**: 
  - `explore-plan-code-commit.md` - Structured development process
  - `visual-iteration.md` - Screenshot-driven UI development
- **Enhanced TDD**: Updated `test-driven.md` with failure verification and overfitting prevention
- **Quality Assurance**: All 41 tests continue to pass, ensuring no breaking changes

### Files modified:
- `lib/chiron/templates/rails/CLAUDE.md.erb` - Added best practices sections
- `lib/chiron/templates/python/CLAUDE.md.erb` - Added best practices sections  
- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/create-prd.md` - Added extended thinking trigger
- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/quality/test-driven.md` - Enhanced with failure verification
- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/explore-plan-code-commit.md` - New comprehensive workflow
- `lib/chiron/templates/shared/commands/workflows/visual-iteration.md` - New UI development workflow

---

## 2025-07-01 - Major Enhancement: Comprehensive Python Project Support
**Developer(s)**: Claude Code | **Branch**: main | **Context**: User request for Python support

### What was accomplished today:
- **Major Feature Release**: Added complete Python project support to Chiron gem
- **Framework Detection**: Implemented auto-detection for Django, FastAPI, Flask, and generic Python projects
- **Architecture Overhaul**: Created `ProjectConfig` class for language-agnostic tool management
- **Template Reorganization**: Restructured templates into `rails/`, `python/`, and `shared/` directories
- **Comprehensive Testing**: Expanded test suite from 5 to 41 tests with full Python coverage
- **Documentation Update**: Enhanced README, CHANGELOG, and CLI help with Python examples
- **RubyGems Publication**: Successfully published version 0.2.0 to RubyGems

### Technical decisions made:
- **Multi-Language Architecture**: Designed extensible system supporting both Rails and Python
- **Project Detection**: Auto-detects project type via `requirements.txt`, `pyproject.toml`, `setup.py`, `Pipfile`
- **Framework Intelligence**: Identifies Django (`manage.py`), FastAPI/Flask (via requirements analysis)
- **Template Strategy**: Shared workflows with language-specific conventions and patterns
- **Backward Compatibility**: Maintained 100% compatibility with existing Rails functionality
- **Configuration Management**: `ProjectConfig` class abstracts tool selection (pytest vs RSpec, black vs RuboCop)

### Features added:
- **Python CLI Options**: `--type=python`, `--with-django`, `--with-fastapi` flags
- **Smart Project Detection**: Interactive prompts for unknown project types
- **Python Workflow Templates**:
  - Python Conventions (PEP 8, type hints, async patterns, framework best practices)
  - Python Testing (pytest patterns, fixtures, mocking, async testing, CI/CD)
  - Python Debugging (pdb workflows, logging strategies, performance profiling)
  - Python Refactoring (SOLID principles, design patterns, code organization)
  - Flask Development (blueprints, forms, testing, deployment patterns)
- **Framework-Specific Content**: Dynamic CLAUDE.md templates based on detected frameworks
- **Project-Specific Tips**: Contextual setup guidance after initialization

### Code quality metrics:
- **RSpec**: 41 examples, 0 failures (8x increase in test coverage)
- **New Test Categories**: Framework detection, ProjectConfig functionality, Python workflows
- **RuboCop**: 29 minor offenses (mostly method length in CLI - acceptable for feature-rich CLI)
- **Backward Compatibility**: All existing Rails tests continue to pass

### Architecture improvements:
- **Template Structure**: 
  ```
  lib/chiron/templates/
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ rails/           # Rails-specific templates
  ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ python/          # Python-specific templates  
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ shared/          # Language-agnostic workflows
  ```
- **Language Detection**: Robust project type identification with fallback mechanisms
- **Tool Configuration**: Abstracted command generation for testing, linting, formatting
- **ERB Enhancement**: Framework-aware template rendering with conditional content

### Bugs fixed:
- **Template Fallbacks**: Graceful handling when project-specific templates don't exist
- **CLI Robustness**: Improved error handling for unknown project types
- **Cross-Platform**: Ensured Python detection works across different package managers

### Version and release:
- **Version Bump**: 0.1.0 ‚Üí 0.2.0 (major feature enhancement)
- **Gem Build**: Successfully built `chiron-0.2.0.gem`
- **RubyGems**: Published to RubyGems registry
- **Documentation**: Comprehensive CHANGELOG with technical details

### Impact and usage:
- **Multi-Language Support**: Chiron now serves both Rails and Python ecosystems
- **Framework Coverage**: Django, FastAPI, Flask, and generic Python projects supported
- **Developer Experience**: Auto-detection eliminates manual configuration
- **Workflow Richness**: Language-specific best practices and patterns included

### Next steps:
- Monitor RubyGems adoption and user feedback
- Consider additional language support (Node.js, Go, etc.)
- Enhance framework detection with more sophisticated analysis
- Add more Python-specific workflow templates based on community needs
- Create video documentation showing Python project initialization

### Notes:
- This represents the largest enhancement to Chiron since its creation
- Successfully maintained backward compatibility while adding major new functionality
- Python support is comprehensive and production-ready
- Architecture now supports easy addition of future languages

---

## 2025-01-21 - Initial Setup and Module Rename
**Developer(s)**: Claude Code | **Branch**: main | **Context**: Initial gem development

### What was accomplished today:
- Set up complete gem development infrastructure
- Initialized git repository with proper .gitignore
- Created comprehensive RSpec test suite (5 tests, all passing)
- Set up GitHub Actions CI for Ruby 3.0-3.3
- Added CHANGELOG.md and MIT LICENSE
- Updated README with chiron branding and examples
- Added RuboCop configuration and fixed style issues
- Renamed module from `ClaudeRailsSetup` to `Chiron` throughout codebase
- Updated email to GitHub no-reply address
- Added Claude workflows to the gem itself (meta!)

### Technical decisions made:
- **Module Naming**: Changed from `ClaudeRailsSetup` to `Chiron` for better branding
- **File Structure**: Moved `lib/claude_rails_setup/` to `lib/chiron/`
- **Testing Strategy**: Used temporary directories and mocked TTY::Prompt for CLI tests
- **CI/CD**: GitHub Actions with matrix testing across Ruby versions
- **Code Quality**: RuboCop with single quotes, 120 character line length

### Bugs fixed:
- Fixed missing `Date` require in CLI for ERB template processing
- Fixed missing `version` method in CLI class
- Updated all module references after rename
- Fixed test directory handling by using `Dir.chdir` instead of mocking

### Features added:
- Complete gem development infrastructure
- Module rename from old name to Chiron
- Self-hosting: Added Claude workflows to the gem itself using its own templates

### Code quality metrics:
- RSpec: 5 examples, 0 failures
- RuboCop: 15 minor style violations (mostly method length, acceptable for CLI)
- Test Coverage: CLI functionality well covered

### Next steps:
- Create GitHub repository and push code
- Test gem building and installation
- Consider adding more comprehensive CLI tests
- Add contribution guidelines
- Prepare for RubyGems publishing

### Notes:
- The gem now "eats its own dog food" by using Claude workflows for its own development
- All original functionality preserved during module rename
- Ready for GitHub publication and RubyGems release

---

file.content:
# frozen_string_literal: true

require_relative 'lib/chiron/version'

Gem::Specification.new do |spec|
  spec.name = 'chiron'
  spec.version = Chiron::VERSION
  spec.authors = ['Brett McHargue']
  spec.email = ['ebrett@users.noreply.github.com']

  spec.summary = 'Initialize Claude AI workflow for Rails and Python projects'
  spec.description = 'A Ruby gem that sets up Claude AI development workflows, PRD templates, ' \
                     'and journaling system for Rails and Python projects'
  spec.homepage = 'https://github.com/ebrett/chiron'
  spec.license = 'MIT'
  spec.required_ruby_version = '>= 3.0.0'

  spec.metadata['homepage_uri'] = spec.homepage
  spec.metadata['source_code_uri'] = spec.homepage
  spec.metadata['changelog_uri'] = "#{spec.homepage}/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md"
  spec.metadata['rubygems_mfa_required'] = 'true'

  # Specify which files should be added to the gem when it is released.
  spec.files = Dir.chdir(__dir__) do
    `git ls-files -z`.split("\x0").reject do |f|
      (f == __FILE__) || f.match(%r{\A(?:(?:bin|test|spec|features)/|\.(?:git|circleci)|appveyor)})
    end
  end
  spec.bindir = 'exe'
  spec.executables = spec.files.grep(%r{\Aexe/}) { |f| File.basename(f) }
  spec.require_paths = ['lib']

  # Runtime dependencies
  spec.add_dependency 'colorize', '~> 1.1'
  spec.add_dependency 'thor', '~> 1.3'
  spec.add_dependency 'tty-prompt', '~> 0.23'

  # Development dependencies
  spec.add_development_dependency 'bundler', '~> 2.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rake', '~> 13.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rspec', '~> 3.0'
  spec.add_development_dependency 'rubocop', '~> 1.21'
end

     8‚Üírequire 'date'
     9‚Üí
    10‚Üímodule Chiron
    11‚Üí  class CLI < Thor
    12‚Üí    def self.exit_on_failure?
    13‚Üí      true
    14‚Üí    end
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí    desc 'init', 'Initialize Claude workflow in current project'
    17‚Üí    option :project_name, type: :string, desc: 'Project name for CLAUDE.md'
    18‚Üí    option :user_name, type: :string, desc: 'User name for templates. Auto-detected from git config if not specified'
    19‚Üí    option :type, type: :string, desc: 'Project type (rails, python). Auto-detected if not specified'
    20‚Üí    option :with_oauth, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include OAuth workflow examples'
    21‚Üí    option :with_viewcomponents, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include ViewComponent rules'
    22‚Üí    option :with_django, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include Django-specific patterns'
    23‚Üí    option :with_fastapi, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Include FastAPI-specific patterns'
    24‚Üí    option :skip_journal, type: :boolean, default: false, desc: 'Skip development journal setup'
    25‚Üí    def init
    26‚Üí      say 'ü§ñ Initializing Claude Setup...'.colorize(:blue)
    27‚Üí
    28‚Üí      @prompt = TTY::Prompt.new
    29‚Üí      @project_type = determine_project_type
    30‚Üí      @project_name = options[:project_name] || prompt_for_project_name
    31‚Üí      @user_name = options[:user_name] || detect_user_name
    32‚Üí
    33‚Üí      # Set up project configuration
    34‚Üí      if @project_type == :python
    35‚Üí        @python_framework = detect_python_framework
    36‚Üí        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type, @python_framework)
    37‚Üí      else
    38‚Üí        @config = ProjectConfig.new(@project_type)
    39‚Üí      end
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí      check_project_compatibility
    42‚Üí      create_directories
    43‚Üí      copy_templates
    44‚Üí      update_gitignore
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Claude workflow initialized successfully!".colorize(:green)
    47‚Üí      say "\nNext steps:".colorize(:yellow)
    48‚Üí      say '  1. Review and customize CLAUDE.md for your project'
    49‚Üí      say '  2. Check .claude/commands/ for available workflows'
    50‚Üí      say "  3. Run 'claude' to start using Claude with your new setup"
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí      # Project-specific suggestions
    53‚Üí      case @project_type
    54‚Üí      when :python
    55‚Üí        say "\nPython project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
    56‚Üí        say '  - Install dev dependencies: pip install pytest black flake8'
    57‚Üí        say '  - Set up pre-commit hooks for code quality'
    58‚Üí        say '  - Configure your IDE to use black formatting'
    59‚Üí      when :rails
    60‚Üí        say "\nRails project tips:".colorize(:yellow)
    61‚Üí        say '  - Ensure binstubs are set up: bundle binstubs bundler --force'
    62‚Üí        say "  - Run 'bin/rubocop' to check code style"
    63‚Üí        say "  - Use 'bin/rspec' for running tests"
    64‚Üí      end
    65‚Üí    end
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí    desc 'migrate-cursor', 'Migrate from .cursor to .claude structure'
    68‚Üí    def migrate_cursor
    69‚Üí      say 'üîÑ Migrating from .cursor to .claude...'.colorize(:blue)
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí      unless Dir.exist?('.cursor/rules')
    72‚Üí        error 'No .cursor/rules directory found!'
    73‚Üí        exit 1
    74‚Üí      end
    75‚Üí
    76‚Üí      create_directories
    77‚Üí      migrate_rules
    78‚Üí
    79‚Üí      if @prompt.yes?('Remove .cursor directory after migration?')
    80‚Üí        FileUtils.rm_rf('.cursor')
    81‚Üí        say '‚úÖ .cursor directory removed'.colorize(:green)
    82‚Üí      end
    83‚Üí
    84‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Migration completed!".colorize(:green)
    85‚Üí    end
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí    desc 'add-workflow WORKFLOW', 'Add a specific workflow to your setup'
    88‚Üí    def add_workflow(workflow_name)
    89‚Üí      available_workflows = Dir.glob(File.join(templates_path, 'commands/**/*.md'))
    90‚Üí                               .map { |f| File.basename(f, '.md') }
    91‚Üí
    92‚Üí      unless available_workflows.include?(workflow_name)
    93‚Üí        error "Unknown workflow: #{workflow_name}"
    94‚Üí        say "Available workflows: #{available_workflows.join(', ')}"
    95‚Üí        exit 1
    96‚Üí      end
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí      copy_workflow(workflow_name)
    99‚Üí      say "‚úÖ Added #{workflow_name} workflow".colorize(:green)
   100‚Üí    end
   101‚Üí
   102‚Üí    desc 'update', 'Update Claude workflows to latest version'
   103‚Üí    def update
   104‚Üí      say 'üîÑ Updating Claude workflows...'.colorize(:blue)
   105‚Üí
   106‚Üí      # Backup current commands
   107‚Üí      if Dir.exist?('.claude/commands')
   108‚Üí        backup_dir = ".claude/commands.backup.#{Time.now.strftime('%Y%m%d%H%M%S')}"
   109‚Üí        FileUtils.cp_r('.claude/commands', backup_dir)
   110‚Üí        say "üì¶ Backed up current commands to #{backup_dir}".colorize(:yellow)
   111‚Üí      end
   112‚Üí
   113‚Üí      copy_templates(update: true)
   114‚Üí      say "\n‚ú® Workflows updated!".colorize(:green)
   115‚Üí    end
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí    desc 'doctor', 'Check Claude setup health'
   118‚Üí    def doctor
   119‚Üí      say 'üè• Running Claude setup diagnostics...'.colorize(:blue)
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí      project_type = detect_project_type
   122‚Üí      checks = {
   123‚Üí        "#{project_type.to_s.capitalize} project" => project_type != :unknown,
   124‚Üí        'CLAUDE.md exists' => File.exist?('CLAUDE.md'),
   125‚Üí        '.claude directory' => Dir.exist?('.claude'),
   126‚Üí        '.claude/commands' => Dir.exist?('.claude/commands'),
   127‚Üí        'Development journal' => File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md'),
   128‚Üí        'Tasks directory' => Dir.exist?('tasks'),
   129‚Üí        '.gitignore entry' => begin
   130‚Üí          File.read('.gitignore').include?('.claude/')
   131‚Üí        rescue StandardError
   132‚Üí          false
   133‚Üí        end
   134‚Üí      }
   135‚Üí
   136‚Üí      # Add project-specific checks
   137‚Üí      case project_type
   138‚Üí      when :rails
   139‚Üí        checks['Gemfile exists'] = File.exist?('Gemfile')
   140‚Üí        checks['Rails app structure'] = Dir.exist?('app')
   141‚Üí      when :python
   142‚Üí        checks['Python package file'] = python_package_exists?
   143‚Üí      end
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí      checks.each do |check, result|
   146‚Üí        status = result ? '‚úÖ'.colorize(:green) : '‚ùå'.colorize(:red)
   147‚Üí        say "#{status} #{check}"
   148‚Üí      end
   149‚Üí
   150‚Üí      if checks.values.all?
   151‚Üí        say "\n‚ú® All checks passed!".colorize(:green)
   152‚Üí      else
   153‚Üí        say "\n‚ö†Ô∏è  Some checks failed. Run 'chiron init' to fix.".colorize(:yellow)
   154‚Üí      end
   155‚Üí    end
   156‚Üí
   157‚Üí    desc 'version', 'Show version'
   158‚Üí    def version
   159‚Üí      say Chiron::VERSION
   160‚Üí    end
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí    private
   163‚Üí
   164‚Üí    def prompt_for_project_name
   165‚Üí      @prompt.ask("What's your project name?") do |q|
   166‚Üí        q.required true
   167‚Üí        q.default File.basename(Dir.pwd)
   168‚Üí      end
   169‚Üí    end
   170‚Üí
   171‚Üí    def determine_project_type
   172‚Üí      return options[:type].to_sym if options[:type]
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí      detected_type = detect_project_type
   175‚Üí      if detected_type == :unknown
   176‚Üí        @prompt.select('What type of project is this?') do |menu|
   177‚Üí          menu.choice 'Rails', :rails
   178‚Üí          menu.choice 'Python', :python
   179‚Üí        end
   180‚Üí      else
   181‚Üí        say "Detected #{detected_type} project".colorize(:green)
   182‚Üí        detected_type
   183‚Üí      end
   184‚Üí    end
   185‚Üí
   186‚Üí    def detect_project_type
   187‚Üí      if File.exist?('Gemfile') && File.read('Gemfile').include?('rails')
   188‚Üí        :rails
   189‚Üí      elsif python_package_exists?
   190‚Üí        :python
   191‚Üí      else
   192‚Üí        :unknown
   193‚Üí      end
   194‚Üí    end
   195‚Üí
   196‚Üí    def detect_python_framework
   197‚Üí      if File.exist?('manage.py')
   198‚Üí        :django
   199‚Üí      elsif File.exist?('app.py') || File.exist?('main.py')
   200‚Üí        if File.exist?('requirements.txt')
   201‚Üí          content = File.read('requirements.txt')
   202‚Üí          return :fastapi if content.include?('fastapi')
   203‚Üí          return :flask if content.include?('flask')
   204‚Üí        end
   205‚Üí        :generic
   206‚Üí      else
   207‚Üí        :generic
   208‚Üí      end
   209‚Üí    end
   210‚Üí
   211‚Üí    def check_project_compatibility
   212‚Üí      case @project_type
   213‚Üí      when :rails
   214‚Üí        unless File.exist?('Gemfile')
   215‚Üí          error "This doesn't appear to be a Rails project!"
   216‚Üí          exit 1
   217‚Üí        end
   218‚Üí      when :python
   219‚Üí        if !python_package_exists? && @prompt.yes?('No Python package file found. Create requirements.txt?')
   220‚Üí          File.write('requirements.txt', "# Python dependencies\n")
   221‚Üí        end
   222‚Üí      end
   223‚Üí    end
   224‚Üí
   225‚Üí    def create_directories
   226‚Üí      dirs = [
   227‚Üí        '.claude/commands/workflows',
   228‚Üí        '.claude/commands/conventions',
   229‚Üí        '.claude/commands/context',
   230‚Üí        '.claude/commands/journal',
   231‚Üí        '.claude/commands/quality',
   232‚Üí        'tasks',
   233‚Üí        'docs'
   234‚Üí      ]
   235‚Üí
   236‚Üí      dirs.each do |dir|
   237‚Üí        FileUtils.mkdir_p(dir)
   238‚Üí        say "üìÅ Created #{dir}".colorize(:light_blue) unless Dir.exist?(dir)
   239‚Üí      end
   240‚Üí    end
   241‚Üí
   242‚Üí    def copy_templates(update: false)
   243‚Üí      # Copy CLAUDE.md template
   244‚Üí      unless update
   245‚Üí        template_path = File.join(templates_path, @project_type.to_s, 'CLAUDE.md.erb')
   246‚Üí        # Fall back to shared template if project-specific doesn't exist
   247‚Üí        template_path = File.join(templates_path, 'CLAUDE.md.erb') unless File.exist?(template_path)
   248‚Üí
   249‚Üí        if File.exist?(template_path)
   250‚Üí          @python_framework = detect_python_framework if @project_type == :python
   251‚Üí          content = ERB.new(File.read(template_path)).result(binding)
   252‚Üí          File.write('CLAUDE.md', content)
   253‚Üí          say 'üìÑ Created CLAUDE.md'.colorize(:light_blue)
   254‚Üí        end
   255‚Üí      end
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí      # Copy command templates
   258‚Üí      copy_commands
   259‚Üí
   260‚Üí      # Copy settings.json
   261‚Üí      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'claude', 'settings.json')
   262‚Üí      # Fall back to root claude dir if shared doesn't exist
   263‚Üí      settings_path = File.join(templates_path, 'claude', 'settings.json') unless File.exist?(settings_path)
   264‚Üí
   265‚Üí      if File.exist?(settings_path) && !File.exist?('.claude/settings.json')
   266‚Üí        FileUtils.cp(settings_path, '.claude/settings.json')
   267‚Üí        say '‚öôÔ∏è  Created .claude/settings.json'.colorize(:light_blue)
   268‚Üí      end
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí      # Initialize development journal
   271‚Üí      return if options[:skip_journal] || File.exist?('docs/development_journal.md')
   272‚Üí
   273‚Üí      create_development_journal
   274‚Üí    end
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí    def copy_commands
   277‚Üí      # Copy shared commands first
   278‚Üí      shared_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'commands')
   279‚Üí      if Dir.exist?(shared_commands_dir)
   280‚Üí        Dir.glob(File.join(shared_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
   281‚Üí          relative_path = file.sub("#{shared_commands_dir}/", '')
   282‚Üí          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)
   283‚Üí
   284‚Üí          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
   285‚Üí          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
   286‚Üí          say "üìã Copied shared: #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
   287‚Üí        end
   288‚Üí      end
   289‚Üí
   290‚Üí      # Copy project-specific commands
   291‚Üí      project_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, @project_type.to_s, 'commands')
   292‚Üí      if Dir.exist?(project_commands_dir)
   293‚Üí        Dir.glob(File.join(project_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
   294‚Üí          relative_path = file.sub("#{project_commands_dir}/", '')
   295‚Üí          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)
   296‚Üí
   297‚Üí          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
   298‚Üí          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
   299‚Üí          say "üìã Copied #{@project_type}: #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
   300‚Üí        end
   301‚Üí      end
   302‚Üí
   303‚Üí      # Fall back to legacy commands if new structure doesn't exist
   304‚Üí      legacy_commands_dir = File.join(templates_path, 'commands')
   305‚Üí      if !Dir.exist?(shared_commands_dir) && !Dir.exist?(project_commands_dir) && Dir.exist?(legacy_commands_dir)
   306‚Üí        Dir.glob(File.join(legacy_commands_dir, '**/*.md')).each do |file|
   307‚Üí          relative_path = file.sub("#{legacy_commands_dir}/", '')
   308‚Üí          target_path = File.join('.claude/commands', relative_path)
   309‚Üí
   310‚Üí          FileUtils.mkdir_p(File.dirname(target_path))
   311‚Üí          FileUtils.cp(file, target_path)
   312‚Üí          say "üìã Copied #{relative_path}".colorize(:light_blue)
   313‚Üí        end
   314‚Üí      end
   315‚Üí    end
   316‚Üí
   317‚Üí    def create_development_journal
   318‚Üí      journal_template = File.join(templates_path, 'shared', 'development_journal.md.erb')
   319‚Üí      # Fall back to root if shared doesn't exist
   320‚Üí      journal_template = File.join(templates_path, 'development_journal.md.erb') unless File.exist?(journal_template)
   321‚Üí      return unless File.exist?(journal_template)
   322‚Üí
   323‚Üí      content = ERB.new(File.read(journal_template)).result(binding)
   324‚Üí      File.write('docs/development_journal.md', content)
   325‚Üí      say 'üìì Created development journal'.colorize(:light_blue)
   326‚Üí    end
   327‚Üí
   328‚Üí    def update_gitignore
   329‚Üí      gitignore_path = '.gitignore'
   330‚Üí      return unless File.exist?(gitignore_path)
   331‚Üí
   332‚Üí      gitignore_content = File.read(gitignore_path)
   333‚Üí
   334‚Üí      return if gitignore_content.include?('.claude/')
   335‚Üí
   336‚Üí      File.open(gitignore_path, 'a') do |f|
   337‚Üí        f.puts "\n# Claude Code settings (but allow commands directory)"
   338‚Üí        f.puts '.claude/*'
   339‚Üí        f.puts '!.claude/commands/'
   340‚Üí      end
   341‚Üí      say 'üìù Updated .gitignore'.colorize(:light_blue)
   342‚Üí    end
   343‚Üí
   344‚Üí    def migrate_rules
   345‚Üí      Dir.glob('.cursor/rules/*.mdc').each do |rule_file|
   346‚Üí        filename = File.basename(rule_file, '.mdc')
   347‚Üí
   348‚Üí        # Map cursor rules to claude command structure
   349‚Üí        target_dir = case filename
   350‚Üí                     when 'create-prd', 'generate-tasks', 'process-task-list'
   351‚Üí                       '.claude/commands/workflows'
   352‚Üí                     when 'rails', 'view_component'
   353‚Üí                       '.claude/commands/conventions'
   354‚Üí                     when 'test-driven'
   355‚Üí                       '.claude/commands/quality'
   356‚Üí                     else
   357‚Üí                       '.claude/commands/workflows'
   358‚Üí                     end
   359‚Üí
   360‚Üí        target_path = File.join(target_dir, "#{filename}.md")
   361‚Üí
   362‚Üí        # Copy and transform the content
   363‚Üí        content = File.read(rule_file)
   364‚Üí        # Remove cursor-specific frontmatter
   365‚Üí        content = content.sub(/---.*?---/m, '').strip
   366‚Üí
   367‚Üí        File.write(target_path, content)
   368‚Üí        say "üìã Migrated #{filename}".colorize(:light_blue)
   369‚Üí      end
   370‚Üí    end
   371‚Üí
   372‚Üí    def templates_path
   373‚Üí      Chiron.templates_path
   374‚Üí    end
   375‚Üí
   376‚Üí    def python_package_exists?
   377‚Üí      File.exist?('requirements.txt') || File.exist?('pyproject.toml') ||
   378‚Üí        File.exist?('setup.py') || File.exist?('Pipfile')
   379‚Üí    end
   380‚Üí
   381‚Üí    def detect_user_name
   382‚Üí      # Try git config first
   383‚Üí      git_user = `git config user.name 2>/dev/null`.strip
   384‚Üí      return git_user if !git_user.empty?
   385‚Üí
   386‚Üí      # Fall back to environment variables
   387‚Üí      env_user = ENV['USER'] || ENV['USERNAME']
   388‚Üí      return env_user if env_user && !env_user.empty?
   389‚Üí
   390‚Üí      # Last resort: prompt the user
   391‚Üí      @prompt.ask('What is your name?', default: 'Developer')
   392‚Üí    rescue StandardError
   393‚Üí      'Developer'
   394‚Üí    end
   395‚Üí
   396‚Üí    def error(message)
   397‚Üí      say "‚ùå #{message}".colorize(:red)
   398‚Üí    end
   399‚Üí  end
   400‚Üíend
